benchmark_details.name: MinorBench
benchmark_details.overview: MinorBench is an open-source benchmark designed to evaluate LLMs on their ability to refuse unsafe or inappropriate queries from children.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess large language models (LLMs) on handling age-inappropriate questions and to provide a benchmark for testing AI moderation systems in educational contexts.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: MinorBench is relatively small compared to other benchmarks, but is designed for high-quality datasets.

data.source: Curated dataset of 299 user queries categorized by content-based risks for children.
data.annotation: Manually curated with a focus on queries children may ask regarding unsafe or inappropriate content.

methodology.calculation: Refusal Rate = (Number of refused prompts / Number of prompts in the category) Ã— 100.
methodology.interpretation: Higher refusal rates indicate stricter adherence to content-safety guidelines for child-unsafe requests.
methodology.baseline_results: Results vary significantly by model and system prompt variations, with some models achieving over 90% refusal rates.
methodology.validation: Testing was conducted across various prompts using six different LLMs under four variations of system prompts.
